name: Double-Handled Tug Toy
description: If you have a dog that loves tug-o'-war and loves to thrash things about, it's important to build structure around this play and to have a solid "OUT" command.

name: Cato Board
description: This sturdy platform aids in doing field work and helps with "shaping" positions like sit and down.

name: Touch Pad
description: A rubber feed pan (4 or 8 quart) is a popular tool for teaching rear-end awareness. Also called the "perch box" or "pivot bowl." Watch this video. Or this one from Emily Larlham.

name: Flirt Pole
description: Yes, it's essentially the cat toy but sized up for dogs. Dogs with even medium prey drive levels go bonkers for it and we can use that motivation to gamify obedience like "down" and "drop it." I like this retractible model.

name: Flirt Pole Lure (upgrade)
description: This is a much tougher and washable vinyl lure to attach to your flirt pole.

name: Chuckit Paraflight
description: The Chuckit Paraflight is a toy you'll see everywhere. It throws great, it floats, it's easy for the dog to pick up even when lying flat on the ground.

name: Chuckit Foldable Launcher
description: I meet so many people that didn't know Chuckit makes a foldable version of their largest launcher! FWAP!

name: Chuckit Kick Ball
description: Mix up your fetch games with this kickball. Dogs can easily pick this ball up because of the grooves.

name: Chuckit Glow Ball
description: Bring a flashlight to keep it glowing. This one is much lighter, cheaper, and safer than the battery powered LED ones.

name: Glow Collar
description: For less than $10 you can make your dog look as fly as Josie here. Great for camping and night time activities. Get the rechargeable plastic tube one.

name: Remote Collar
description: "Lowest perceptible level" e-collar training is a method that uses uses extremely low levels. We intentionally avoid aversive or even uncomfortable levels. When used correctly this amazing tool opens up a world of off-leash freedom.
